summary:
A successful Shell executive, with 32 years broad production management experience in both surface and sub-surface oil & gas operations, onshore and offshore. Completed 10 varied international assignments for Shell EP in Gabon, The Netherlands, Brunei and Oman. Recently Director of Operations for Shell Gabon, on the company senior leadership team, managing a department of 300 staff in field operations, maintenance, production services and logistics. Prior to moving to Gabon, leading the Operations Excellence department for Europe, Middle East, Africa & Russia/Caspian region, consisting of +- 75 senior professionals in the disciplines of Operations Readiness, Operations management, Maintenance & Reliability and Logistics. Senior operations management potential, leadership experience, strong communicator, experienced in managing change and leading large, inter-disciplinary departments. A large personal network of oilfield professionals around the world.  A self starter, able to work independently, with strong conceptual thinking skills. An engineer with an artistic and creative bias, who enjoys working with people. Currently obtaining broader business management skills to enhance existing operations and man management skills.

Specialties: Operations Excellence, business plans, business process, change management, coaching, communication skills, concept development, consulting, continuous improvement, documentation, dutch, functional management, hazop, leadership, materials management, mechanical engineering, operations management, process engineering, production,  project management, proposal writing, quality, quality control,  recruiting, risk assessment,  safety, supervisory skills, technical management,  training programs

school.name: University of Manchester - Institute of Science and Technology

profile_positions.description: Contracted to ADNOC technical Centre in Abu Dhabi as a Senior Technical Advisor, reporting to the Operations Excellence Manager, responsible to advise on all aspects of designing and implementing world class Operations standards across all ADNOC companies.
profile_positions.title: Tecnical Advisor, Operations Excellence

profile_positions.description: Relocated to UK (base country) pending re-assignment.
profile_positions.title: Senior Operations Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Responsible to manage all production, maintenance and logistics operations in Shell Gabon, across all Shell operated assets (Rabi, Toucan, Gamba, Koula). Member of Shell Gabon Leadership Team, reporting directly to PDG. Gabon is part of the Equatorial African tropical forest, the second largest block of tropical forest on earth.
Shell Gabon is a medium-sized company with a strong portfolio and overall production capacity of 65kb/d – approximately 25% of Gabon’s production. Key onshore operating assets comprise Rabi (one of the largest fields in sub-Saharan Africa), Gamba-Ivinga, Toucan and the recently discovered and now producing, Koula Field. In the past few years production decline has been arrested through employing state of the art Well & Reservoir Management technology. Recent business plans call for an expansion in the drilling and workover activities in Shell Gabon. Shell Gabon currently runs 2 rigs and 1 hoist. In addition, the maturation of the highly prospective deep offshore area offers promise of further exploration opportunities over the next few years.
The role also oversee the Gamba Terminal (40+ year old asset) – one of two terminals in Gabon processing >50% of Gabon’s onshore crude. The Terminal is currently undergoing a rejuvenation to address reliability and performance challenges. 
Keeping the entire operations running safely requires maintaining high HSE standards. This is only possible by the conscious development of a HSE culture, which extends to the work force of Services Contractors.
profile_positions.title: Operations Manager

profile_positions.description: Responsibe within Shell Projects & Technology for a department of +- 75 senior professionals in the disciplines of Operations Readiness, Operations Management, Maintenance & Integrity, Reliability and Logistics. Supporting Major Shell Projects and Operating Companies, within Upstream, Downstream and LNG in a range of consultancy and support services.
profile_positions.title: Regional Manager Operations Excellence

profile_positions.description: Responsible for Operations Readiness delivery in all upstream and downstream projects in Shell's Projects & Technology group.
profile_positions.title: Delivery Manager Operations Readiness

profile_positions.description: Global Discipline lead for Operations in Shell Global Solutions, providing Front End engineering services and Operations management consultancy services to Shell internal clients globally.
profile_positions.title: Snr Operations consultant and global Discipline Head

profile_positions.description: Responsible to lead a team of operations consultants providing operations readiness services to the Major projects group, for projects in the EMEA region, at all stages of the development lifecycle.
profile_positions.title: Senior Operations Consultant

profile_positions.description: Reporting to the EP recruitment manager, and working closely with the Global skill pool manager,  responsible for coordinating and directing all global recruitment activities for the Production engineering skillpool, as the single interface between the central Attraction and Recruitment (A&R) organization and the technical businesses.  This involves working through a global network of recruiters, skill pool managers and technical discipline heads to define the business needs and initiate external recruitment campaigns to meet them. I am also responsible for analyzing and improving the recruitment process, so that I leave behind me an efficient and sustainable process, with which the A&R organization can interface seamlessly with the EP technical business in order to meet well defined business requirements.
profile_positions.title: Global Recruitment Coordinator

profile_positions.description: Reporting to the Regional Maintenance and Engineering Manager, I was single point responsible for leading the Total Reliability effort in EP Asia Pacific. The programme aims to demonstrate "world class" operational performance against industry benchamrks by end 2008, reducing unscheduled production deferment from current levels of 8 % to a targeted 3 %. Building on a very successful launch campaign and communication programme, TR has become a high profile global initiative, followed with close interest by Shell EP senior management. My personal drive and enthusiasm for this fascinating change management programme contributed to my getting this strong senior management commitment, and I established a powerful guiding coalition across the region. This enabled me to acquire the necessary resources and priority to put in place a long term, sustainable programme of continuous improvement. The role involved creating and communicating a successful strategy, working with "Change Agents" to manage and implement a portfolio of change projects, educating the operations workforce in new ways of working, demonstrating business benefits, and interfacing with other regions to ensure a consistent, standardized approach. During the first year of the programme we realized  tangible business benefits ( 300 KBOE production gain, US$ 200,000 cost savings realized to date, with proven potential for five times as much in 2006
profile_positions.title: Brunei	Regional Lead

profile_positions.description: Head of a multi-disciplinary department of 130 people providing technical services to Asset teams in the areas of  static engineering & maintenance, pipelines, production chemistry, inspection, IT systems development, documentation management and technical management systems.
profile_positions.title: Head Static Engineering, Quality and Inspection

profile_positions.description: The Shell EP Learning centre in Noordwijkerhout provides quality learning programmes to EP professional from Shell Operations around the world. Responsible within the Surface Operations Team for development and delivery of production operations & maintenance training programmes. Contributed as Course Director on P-180 (integrated development of surface facilities), and presented Ops/mntc. sessions and personal effectiveness sessions on a variety of other discipline courses. Initially responsible within the team for all innovation projects, which led to development of Shell Open University and the concept of Blended Learning. Converted a 4 week Prod. Ops classroom course into a 20 week Blended Learning programme, containing on-line e-content, quizzes and tasks. It was piloted successfully in Middle East, and is currently leading the way in transforming all learning programmes into far more effective and customer oriented on-line packages. Developed skills in designing and creating e-learning. Participated in a special study team in London to present a business case for creating a company to commercialise e-learning within the Oil business. Member of the original Business Planning team that initiated the transformation of EPT-HL into a more customer focussed learning organisation. Liaised closely with skills managers in setting global competency standards, attended conferences worldwide in leading edge learning technologies. Provided consultancy services to VAR and PTL teams.
profile_positions.title: Production Engineering Course Director

profile_positions.description: As the senior PDO representative in the Nimr area, located in the desert interior, responsible for all interior operations, both production and maintenance. Reporting to the Nimr Operations Manager. Budget responsibility: $32 million.  Asset responsibility: 1 main dehydration and export station, 4 gathering stations, 550 producing wells, over an area of 80 Km diameter.  Line management responsibility for approx. 30 operators/technicians and a team of 6 senior staff supervisors, plus indirect HSE responsibility for a PDO camp of 250 residents and a contractors camp with 2000 residents. Responsible to meet a net oil production target of 28,000 m3/d annual average, whilst disposing 120,000 m3/d produced water into deep water disposal reservoirs. Main objectives: to minimise well and facility related deferment, maintain asset integrity, execute agreed activity plans, meet stringent HSE targets, commission and operate existing and new facilities, manage a tight Opex budget, ensure a well motivated and competent workforce, and continuously strive for improved business performance.
profile_positions.title: Nimr Area Field Production Manager

profile_positions.description: Responsible within the Marmul Op's team for all liaison with Engineering projects.  Involved in the preparation of Operating  philosophies, Op's input to facilities design, long term conceptual design, management of facility change proposals, preparation of Asset reference Plans and Opex models.  Experience was gained preparing the Operations Business Plan on behalf of the Operations manager.  Attended several HAZOP and design reviews. Prepared a detailed Operations Philosophy for a new, major  facilities project. Initiated several improvement projects on behalf of the team, and participated for a year in the Marmul Business Improvement Team.
profile_positions.title: Operations Engineer

profile_positions.description: Responsible for all operations on the 50 outlying structures surrounding the CP-7 main complex, which formed the primary development of the Eastern area. As responsible supervisor for 23 well head jackets, 21 drilling platforms and 6 treatment/export platforms within an area of about 3000 square kilometres, I managed a team of 40 operators who visited the outlying structures daily by means of passenger transport boats. My main duties were planning and supervising the daily operator activities, managing the PTW system, ensuring well test quality and accounting for production deferment. I was involved in preparing workscopes for major maintenance campaigns, including concurrent production & maintenance. I was also involved in commissioning a new gas production wellhead jacket in the Champion West deep gas development.
profile_positions.title: Field Supervisor (relief OIM)

profile_positions.description: Reporting directly to the Senior Operations Supervisor, I was responsible for a staff of 20 operators and foremen and all production operations on the central CP-7 offshore complex, which included: 10 bridge linked platforms with accommodation for 200; oil production, treatment and export; gas compression for export and gas lift (via 2 Avon and 3 Rushton gas turbine driven compressors); water injection and utilities (including 10 MW power supply from Rushton gas turbines). The complex provided the central processing facilities for the whole of BSPs Eastern operation, which amounted to 25,000 m3/d oil production, 3 MM m3/d gas export and 6000 m3/d water injection. As well as being responsible for meeting export and injection targets, I was also responsible for technical integrity, HSE management (including emergency response) and liaison with all engineering and maintenance work boats and barges. As the authorised permit to work signatory, I was responsible for the safety of all operations carried out on the complex. Experience was gained in managing several major Concurrent Operations, involving both construction and major maintenance on "live" producing assets.
profile_positions.title: Offshore Complex Supervisor

profile_positions.description: My initial responsibilities were as Quality Improvement focal point, R&D technology focal point, and all issues related to the Production Operations Management System, such as standards and procedures, operating philosophy, documentation control etc. After developing a contract for a team of consultant technical authors to write a General Operations Philosophy and Operating Manuals for the company, I went on to manage the project full time. The completed project formed the cornerstone of future work in developing a well structured Operations Management System. Experience was gained in all aspects of operations support and input to engineering projects, especially regarding technical integrity, documentation and management systems.
profile_positions.title: Special Studies Supervisor

profile_positions.description: OIM experience as single point responsible person for an offshore gas production platform (K15-FA-1 initially, then K7-Fa-1). Line responsibility for a crew of about 7 operator /technicians who operated and maintained the platform. Experience gained in gas production wells, gas dehydration, condensate stabilisation, water treatment for overboard disposal. Responsible for assuring technical integrity, and for the HSE management of a fully manned offshore platform. Responsible for overseeing several engineering construction programmes. Between two platform supervisor jobs offshore, a period of 1 yr. was spent onshore as a support engineer, undergoing intensive Dutch language training, studying mercury contamination problems and overboard water disposal standards, setting up a training needs analysis and competency assurance system for offshore operators (Proscan), and implementing the new integrated planning and logistics organisation.
profile_positions.title: Offshore Installation Manager
